content: Good summary. 13 mini user here. I'm still happy, or at least I was until Apple forced iOS 26 on me. We'll see how that goes. I charge it on a magsafe stand overnight or magsafe in the car, so 15W / lightning really aren't a huge deal, it lasts me well enough. I use an iPad for a lot of things, so the phone doesn't get used a ton, certainly not doom scrolling. I have a small magsafe battery from baseus which can fully charge it in a pinch, and that's in my bag just in case, but I've only needed it once. I really don't care about Apple Intelligence today, maybe if that gets better, but I'm not holding my breath. I'd like better cameras, and a better display wouldn't hurt. Useful Siri would probably clinch the deal. But I love the mini form factor, I'm really not looking forward to carrying a bigger/heavier phone. My next iPhone will likely be the 17, the improvements over the 16 are compelling.

content:
11:40, while the storage argument is valid if you only buy new, people should seriously consider buying used for big local storage upgrades.

Also, definitely worth considering getting an old mac mini or macbook and just using it as a backup computer with phone data and photo backups. like a $100 2015 macbook pro with 256-512gb of fast storage to offload pics, instead of paying $100 extra to go from a used base 15 Pro Max to a 1TB 15 pro max, for instance.

Also, worth considering getting a used 15 pro or pro max instead of the 17. But i get it if you just prefer new. Just imo, I'd rather have the pro phone, 3 cameras, all for $200-300 less.
